ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

Notes: phq_1+phq_2+phq_3+phq_4+phq_5+phq_6+phq_7+phq_8; greater than or equal to 10 consistent with current depression. The 15-item version has a score ceiling of 30.

ElementDescription: Over the last two weeks, if you checked off any problems (anhedonia, down, sleep_trouble, phq_tired, appetite, failure, concentration_problems, psychomotor_retardation, si_hi), how difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
Notes: 1= Not difficult at all; 2= Somewhat difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult

ElementDescription: Current (Past 2 weeks) PHQ-9 Score

ElementDescription: Lifetime PHQ-9 Score
Notes: Sum of lifetime items phq_q1_lifetime-phq_q9_lifetime

ElementDescription: Over your lifetime, how often have you been bothered with little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several days; 2= More than half of the days; 3= Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Over your lifetime, how often have you been bothered by feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several days; 2= More than half of the days; 3= Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Over your lifetime, how often have you been bothered by trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several days; 2= More than half of the days; 3= Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Over your lifetime, how often have you been bothered by feeling tired or having little energy?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several days; 2= More than half of the days; 3= Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Over your lifetime, how often have you been bothered by poor appetite or overeating?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several days; 2= More than half of the days; 3= Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Over your lifetime, how often have you been bothered by feeling bad about yourself, or that you are a failure, or have let yourself or your family down?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 1= Several days; 2= More than half of the days; 3= Nearly every day

ElementDescription: Over your lifetime, how often have you been bothered by trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television (or daily chores)?
